labour</topcClas>         <topcClas>General - Health</topcClas>         <topcClas>Health services and medical care - Health</topcClas>         <topcClas>Housing</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social indicators and quality of life - Society and culture</topcClas>         <topcClas>Use and provision of specific social services - Social welfare policy and systems</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <I>Continuous Household Survey</I> (CHS) is one of the largest continuous surveys carried out in Northern Ireland.  The survey is designed, conducted and analysed by the Central Survey Unit of the Northern Ireland Statistics and Research Agency (NISRA).  It is based on a sample of the general population resident in private households and has been running since 1983.  The Survey is designed to provide a regular source of information on a wide range of social and economic issues relevant to Northern Ireland.  The CHS is an important source of information in Northern Ireland and is used by many Government departments and Agencies.  Regular clients include the Departments of Enterprise, Trade and Investment, Culture Arts and Leisure, Regional Developments, Environment, Education, Employment and Learning and NISRA. <br> <br> Further information about the series, including methodology, may be found on the NISRA Central Survey Unit (CSU) <a href="http://www.csu.nisra.gov.uk/survey.asp2.htm" title="CSU Surveys: CHS">Continuous Household Survey</a> web pages.<br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br> The main topics covered in this study include education, employment,  family information, health, housing, smoking, drinking, informal caring and income.<br> Some of the questions are based on those asked in the General Household Survey.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="2000-04-01T00:00:00Z">01 April 2000</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2001-03-01T00:00:00Z">March 2001</collDate>         <nation>Northern Ireland</nation>         <geogUnit>No spatial unit</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Families/households</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Households</universe>         <universe>Private households in Northern Ireland.</universe>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Repeated cross-sectional study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>Data are collected annually</timeMeth>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <sampProc>The sample is drawn as a simple random sample from three strata. The first of these strata is the Belfast District Council area. The other two are formed by dividing the remainder of the province into East and West along district council boundaries. Within each of these strata a simple random sample of addresses is drawn, with size proportional to the distribution of domestic addresses on the rating list.</sampProc>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview</collMode>         <collMode>CAPI</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No weighting used</weight>         <cleanOps>A</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage.
